title: Reza presents at AAPM annual meeting

title: Dr. Farnoosh Abbas-Aghababazadeh presents at the upcoming SSC virtual annual meeting

title: Multiple presentations from BHK lab members at the AACR virtual special conference

title: Seyed Ali Madani Tonekaboni becomes Dr. Seyed Ali Madani Tonekaboni

title: Dr. Benjamin Haibe-Kains receives the Bernard and Francine Dorval Prize from Canadian Cancer Society
content: Congragulations to our very own Dr. Benjamin Haibe-Kains who was awarded with the Bernard and Francine Dorval Prize for a young investigator who has made outstanding contributions to basic biomedical research. As the Research at Canadian Cancer Society said on their official twitter page "Dr Benjamin Haibe-Kains, a leader in the field of computational medicine whose work has advanced precision medicine for cancer".   Link: https://twitter.com/ccsresearch/status/1196437221391380480?s=12

title: Dr.Benjamin Haibe-Kains is recognized by Microsoft
content: Microsoft awarded Dr. Benjamin Haibe-Kains with an award as a show appreciation of the partnership between BHK lab and Mircrosoft's Azure project.

Dr. Mahmoud presented his poster on Transcription factor drug sensitivity model based on master regulators and protein abundance.

title: Vector Institute Postgraduate Affiliate Program
content: Dr. Laleh Ghoraie, Petr Smirnov and Ian Smith are now officially members of the Vector Institute Postgraduate Affiliate Program. Established this year, the program will foster collaboration and contributions among students and researchers with expertise in deep learning as well as machine learning and artificial intelligence more broadly. See https://t.co/GB724MbprT for more details.

content:
Arvind Mer, Vandana Sandhu and Venkata Manem give poster presentations at the Accelerating Precision Medicine Conference 2018. 

Talks

 
     
  • Pre-Clinical Assessment of Radiation Response using in-vitro data (Dr. Venkata Manem)
    •  
 

Posters

 
     
  • Pre-Clinical Assessment of Radiation Response using in-vitro data (Dr. Venkata Manem)
    •  
  • Meta-analysis of transcriptomic profiles identifies prognostic model for pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma patients (Dr. Vandana Sandhu)
    •  
  • Comprehensive Assessment of Large Scale Patient Derived Xenografts Data (Dr. Arvind Mer)
    •  
 

Awards

 
     
  • Dr. Vandana Sandhu wins Best Poster award in Accelerating Precision Medicine Conference 2018

title: Dr. Zhaleh Safikhani gives talks at Royan and IPM Institutes
content: Zhaleh Safikhani gives a talk titled Biomarker Discovery in Pharmacogenomics Studies at both the Royan Institute (http://www.royaninstitute.org/cmsen/index.php) and IPM Institute (http://www.ipm.ac.ir/) in Tehran, Iran.

title: PharmacoDB version 1.1.1 is released
content:
PharmacoDB 1.1.1 stable is released. Features: 

     
  • PharmacoDB API at https://api.pharmacodb.com/v1/ has been retired. The API is now only available on https://pharmacodb.pmgenomics.ca/api/v1/.
    •  
 Bugs: 
     
  • Previous database version contained an error matching the gene-drug associations to the datasets. It is specifically known that the, FIMM and CTRPv2 datasets were incorrectly labeled. This has been corrected in the newest dump. DOI: 10.5281/zenodo.1143644
    •  
  • Fixed a bug with outputting the gene-drug table to a csv where the mDataType column was missing.
    •  
  • Added a tissue column to the gene drug table.
    •  
 Release notes are available at https://pharmacodb.pmgenomics.ca/news

title: Dr. Heewon Seo joins the lab as Postdoctoral Fellow
content: Dr. Heewon Seo joins the BHK lab as postdoctoral fellow. Welcome!

title: PharmacoDB version 1.1.0 is released
content:
PharmacoDB 1.1.0 stable is released. Features: 

     
  • Added search feature to the tables in the genes and drugs pages.
    •  
  • Biomarker table in drugs page is now automatically sorted by p-value.
    •  
  • Increased the number of decimal points in the summary statistics table to make it consistent with the exported csv values.
    •  
 Bugs: 
     
  • Fixed incorrect bar plot title in tissues page.
    •  
  • Fixed a bug with the sidebar.
    •  
 Release notes are available at https://pharmacodb.pmgenomics.ca/news.

content: Deena Gendoo, Zhaleh Safikhani, Venkata Manem and Ali Madani present a poster at the Personalized Cancer Medicine in 2016 conference, Toronto, Canada

title: Drs. Gendoo, Safikhani and Manem's presentation
content: Drs. Deena Gendoo, Zhaleh Safikhani and Venkata Manem present their poster at the Canadian Cancer Research Conference, Montreal

title: Dr. Haibe-Kains is Young Investigator for SU2C
content: Dr. Haibe-Kains is Young Investigator in the first Stand-Up To Cancer (SU2C) Canadian DREAM Team

title: Dr. Safikhani received the 2015 Conference Travel Award
content: Dr. Zhaleh Safikhani received the 2015 Conference Travel Award from the UHN Office of Research Trainees

title: Dr. Haibe-Kains received a CIHR New Investigator Award
content: The Canadian Institutes of Health Research (CIHR) has granted Dr. Haibe-Kains an New Investigator Award

title: The Haibe-Kains lab is part of the PanCuRx Program
content: The Haibe-Kains lab is part of the PanCuRx Program funded by the Ontario Institute of Cancer Research (OICR)

title: Heather Selby and Dr. Zhaleh Safikhani’s research presentation
content: Heather Selby and Dr. Zhaleh Safikhani’s research presented at the GTEx Community Meeting in Chicago, USA

title: Drs. Madeline Li and Benjamin Haibe-Kains received a grant
content: Drs. Madeline Li and Benjamin Haibe-Kains received a Princess Margaret Cancer Foundation (PMCF) Collaborative Personalized Cancer Medicine Team grant

title: NSERC has granted Benjamin Haibe-Kains the grant
content: The Natural Sciences and Engineering Research Council of Canada (NSERC) has granted Benjamin Haibe-Kains the Discovery grant entitled “Ensemble framework to infer large-scale causal gene regulatory networks from transcriptomic data”

title: BMC Bioinformatics accepts the paper
content: BMC Bioinformatics accepts the paper “A network model for angiogenesis in ovarian cancer"

title: Bioinformatics accepts the paper
content: Bioinformatics accepts the paper “Test set bias affects reproducibility of gene signatures"

title: Dr. Haibe-Kains received an Early Researcher Award
content: The Ministry of Economic Development and Innovation/Ministry of Research and Innovation of Ontario has granted Dr. Haibe-Kains an Early Researcher Award

title: Deena Gendoo and Zhaleh Safikhani present a poster
content: Dr. Deena Gendoo and Dr. Zhaleh Safikhani present a poster at the conference “Personalized Cancer Medicine in 2015” in Toronto

title: Drs. Goldenberg, Tsao, and Haibe-Kains received grant
content: Drs. Anna Goldenberg, Ming Tsao, and Benjamin Haibe-Kains received a Canadian Cancer Research Society (CCSRI) Innovation grant

title: PNAS accepts the paper
content: PNAS accepts the paper “APOBEC3B expression in breast cancer reflects cellular proliferation while a deletion polymorphism is associated with immune activation”, collaboration with the Mak Lab

title: BHKLAB welcomes Natchar Ratanasirigulchal and Adrian She
content: BHKLAB welcomes Natchar Ratanasirigulchal and Adrian She from UBC as Co-Op Students

title: Nature Communications accepts the paper
content: Nature Communications accepts the paper “ZNF143 provides sequence specificity to secure chromatin interactions at gene promoters”, collaboration with the Lupien Lab

title: BHKLAB welcomes Dr. Venkata Manem
content: BHKLAB welcomes Dr. Venkata Manem as Postdoctoral Fellow

title: BMC Genomics accepts the paper
content: BMC Genomics accepts the paper “Transfer of clinically relevant gene expression signatures in breast cancer: from Affymetrix microarray to Illumina RNA-Sequencing technology”, collaboration wit the Sotiriou Lab

title: Deena Gendoo will be presenting a poster
content: Deena Gendoo will be presenting a poster at the EMBL-EBI/Wellcome Trust Workshop on Resources for Computational Drug Discovery 2014, UK.

title: Benjamin Haibe-Kains officially part of the MAQC consortium
content: Benjamin Haibe-Kains is now officially part of the MAQC consortium

title: CCSRI has granted Dr. Benjamin Haibe-Kains an award
content: The Canadian Cancer Society Research Institute has granted Benjamin Haibe-Kains a Junior Investigator Grant Panel Travel Award.

title: Cancer Research Society funds the project
content: The Cancer Research Society funds the project entitled "Assessment if biomedical relevance of molecular subtyping in breast and ovarian cancers”

title: Nicolas Bouchard receives 2014 IRCM Maria and Lino Ermacora award
content: BHKLAB member Nicolas Bouchard was awarded the 2014 Maria and Lino Ermacora scholarship from Institut de Recheres Chlinique de Montréal for his MSc studies.

title: BHKLAB welcomes Dr. Elham Salehi
content: We are pleased to welcome Dr. Elham Salehi as a new postdoc in the BHKLAB. Elham will be working on developing a novel approach for high-throughput discovery of drug combinations using large-scale pharmacogenomic data. Welcome Elham!

title: Catharina Olsen receives the Solvay Award
content: Visiting postdoctoral researcher Dr. Catharina Olsen was awarded the distinguished Solvay Award. Congratulations!

title: BHKLAB welcomes Dr. Zhaleh Safikhani
content: We are pleased to welcome Dr. Zhaleh Safikhani as a new postdoc in the BHKLAB. Zhaleh will be analyzing next-generation sequencing data from large panels of cancer cell lines to investigate their association between novel genomic features and drug sensitivity. Welcome Zhaleh!

title: Frontiers in Genetics accepts our paper
content: Our paper on the topic "Relevance of different prior knowledge sources for inferring gene interaction networks” was accepted in Frontiers in Genetics: Computational Biology and Bioinformatics. The paper's abstract can be read on the journal's web site. We congratulate lab members Catharina Olsen and Benjamin Haibe-Kains for their contributions.

title: BHKLAB Website Launch!
content: We are excited to announce the launch of the new BHKLAB website!

title: Cancer Research accepts our review
content: Our review about "Enhancing Reproducibility in Cancer Drug Screening: How Do We Move Forward? " was accepted in Cancer Research.

title: Summer students receive CIHR-IG Computational Biology Awards
content: Dong Yao (Donald) Wang and Alain R. Bateman were each awarded the Computational Biology Undergraduate Summer Student Health Research Award from the CIHR Institute of Genetics (CIHR-IG) for their summer internships with the BHKLAB. More information about the award may be found on the CIHR website.
